content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, tangent x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis, and the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following gives the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the vertical line <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to tangent 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 minus, arc tangent y, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 minus, arc tangent y, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to tangent 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 minus, arc tangent y, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 squared, minus, open parenthesis, arc tangent y, close parenthesis, squared, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times the integral from, 0 to tangent 1, of, open parenthesis, 1 minus, arc tangent y, close parenthesis, squared, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.10: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around Other Axes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
